importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The AWS outage occurred on Monday, October 20, 2025, marking a significant moment in cloud infrastructure reliability, illustrating how critical dependencies on centralized services can disrupt global digital operations.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The outage began at 07:11 GMT and lasted approximately three hours, during which 113 AWS services were affected, impacting major apps and websites worldwide.

keyTakeAways: The AWS outage was caused by a technical error during a software update to DynamoDB's API, which disrupted the Domain Name System (DNS) and prevented apps from connecting to server addresses.

The failure propagated through AWS's ecosystem, affecting 113 services and impacting major companies such as Snapchat, Pinterest, WhatsApp, Zoom, Roblox, Fortnite, Starbucks, banks, and news organizations like The New York Times and The Wall Street Journal.
The root cause was human error, not a cyberattack or external threat, as confirmed by cybersecurity expert Bryson Bort of Scythe.
AWS responded swiftly, deploying multiple recovery paths and restoring full operations by 10:11 GMT, though some users experienced message processing backlogs.
Cloud outages are increasingly visible due to widespread reliance on platforms like AWS, which serve as foundational infrastructure for modern digital services.

summaryOfNewsArticle: An AWS outage on Monday, October 20, 2025, began at 07:11 GMT in Virginia’s main data center due to a technical error during a DynamoDB API update that disrupted the Domain Name System (DNS), preventing apps from connecting to servers. This cascaded failure affected 113 AWS services, including major apps like Snapchat, WhatsApp, Roblox, Fortnite, Venmo, and financial platforms such as Coinbase and banks. The outage also impacted media organizations including The New York Times and Wall Street Journal, as well as smart home devices like Ring and Alexa. Experts confirmed the incident was caused by human error, not a cyberattack, and AWS restored services by 10:11 GMT, though some users faced message backlogs. The event underscores the critical dependence of modern digital life—ranging from finance to entertainment and smart devices—on centralized cloud infrastructure, raising awareness about the risks of over-reliance on a single provider.
title: What caused Amazon’s AWS outage, and why did so many major apps go offline?
